alert.note: Alert for Sumner (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 24 at 8:17PM CDT until May 25 at 1:45PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas... Chikaskia River near Corbin affecting Sumner County. For the Chikaskia River...including Corbin...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chikaskia River near Corbin. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Left bank overflows extend out to about 100 yards. A low water bridge on South Sumner Road, 3 miles downstream from gage site or 2 miles southwest of Corbin, floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:01 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 12.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 2.9 feet early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Chikaskia River Corbin 10.0 12.5 Tue 8 pm CDT 6.4 3.3 3.0 &&
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
